title: Laury
lyrics:
The night of heavy rain
When we ran into the park
Took our clothes off
Laughing with no regard for grace
Lying in your embrace

Thought I knew my place

You'd be soft

And I'd be brave

Heavy worry

Couldn't keep up with the pace



Laury

Don't leave with a heavy heart

I love you

But not like til' death do us part

Laury

I know that you'll find someone

I love you

But we both know where I come from



When the winds of change

Come blowing

I won't sway



Driving across the plains

With the windows down

Toronto bound

Sinatra sang Chicago as we came



Singing

Ah ah ting tang walla walla bing bang

Riding just the same

As in my girl

Was it written in the grain



Laury

Don't leave with a heavy heart

I love you

But not like til' death do us part

Laury

I know that you'll find someone

I love you

But we both know where I come from



Where the winds of change

Come blowing

I won't sway



If you want me to

I'll be right there

If you need me to

I'll be right there



Though it's not me that man

I'll always be your man



If you want me to

I'll be right there

If you need me to

I'll be right there

If you want me to

I'll be right there

Oh though it's not me that man

I'll always be your man



Laury

Don't leave with a heavy heart

I love you

But not like til' death do us part

Laury

I know that you'll find someone

I love you

But we both know where I come from



When the winds of change

Come calling

I won't sway
